Olfactory system function.Definition: The olfactory system in most vertebrate species consists of two distinct subsystems: the main olfactory system and the accessory olfactory system. The main olfactory system is generally considered to be important in the detection and processing of airborne chemicals whereas the accessory olfactory system is mainly used in the detection and processing of water-soluble chemicals (http://www.springerreference.com/docs/html/chapterdbid/332953.html).
